fields.description:
BUG+WEIRD 

!http://madbean.com/pub/skitch/2010/view_div_visible_with_edit_div-20100503-155617.jpg!

when you edit a CS comment, then it SAVE, it shows both the EDIT div and the VIEW div until the AJAX returns, and then the EDIT div disappears and the VIEW div updates with new value. This is very confusing and there is no need for our MVP pattern to make it work this way
fields.summary: Changeset comment editing inconsistencies
Snippet comment and the edit dialog should be the same size to avoid excessive redraws

fields.description:
Once a snippet is created, you cannot change the title, content or syntax highlighting.

Allow:
1. title editing via inline edit
2. syntax highlighting selection via inline edit

At this stage, project selection won't be editable.
fields.summary: Snippet details cannot be changed once created

fields.description:
There is currently no way to restore a backup from the web interface because FishEye must be shut down during a data restore.

It would be great to implement this feature in the future release.
fields.summary: Allow restoration process from administration interface

fields.description: In certain circumstances, administrator wants to disable the [User Tracking|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/5gC6D] option for particular user/groups. It would be good to have an option manage by the administrator.
fields.summary: Able to have an option to disable the user tracking feature

fields.description:
When there is no project associated with the default permission scheme, the permission scheme admin page shows up a "delete" link to allow user to delete the default permission scheme.

However, once the default permission scheme is deleted, many functionalities will break, including: fail to instantiate a new project. Recreating a permission scheme named "default" won't fix the problem, as the code assumes the default permission scheme has id of value 1.
fields.summary: Should not allow user to delete default permission scheme
Split ToDo gadget into ToDo and Hassle

fields.description:
current behavior : remove reviewers from a review is only allowed in one by one

suggestion : to have a select all checkbox to remove all reviewers in bulk.
fields.summary: Bulk remove default reviewers

fields.description: At the moment we include a HTML 4.01 transitional doctype but we don't produce valid markup to support that. In the interests of being a good net citizen we should try and produce valid HTML. e.g. we include two target attributes on some links: {noformat}wiki syntax help{noformat}
fields.summary: Make HTML valid according to W3C validator

fields.description:
Currently, if you apply a Crucible evaluation license to _just_ the crucible section of the administration, both FE and CRU are enabled.  Tech Sales has just had a customer turned off to the product because he feels we are giving him a hard-sell on FE that he doesn't want.  Without him contacting us for a new license (developer/demonstration), there is no way to evaluate just Crucible.

Using the Ligh SCM plugin wasn't good enough since it was clear that FishEye features were still usable in the interface.
fields.summary: Cannot evaluate Crucible without FishEye

fields.description:
See screenshots.
Reproducible always.
fields.summary: All Reviews query (filter) does not return snippets, wheras all open reviews does

fields.description: See attached images
fields.summary: filename of 'go google it' breaks the browse/hg-weird-file-names/go google it<\a> page

fields.description:
When searching with a custom filter (e.g. using the REST API) we do a somewhat fuzzy match on things like the review title. This means sometimes you get back less than impressive results especially if your query string has special characters etc. 

In that case it would be useful to provide an exact match so you get the results you really want.
fields.summary: Allow exact matches in review filters

fields.description:
If a comment is made on code not specifically in the review, it isn't shown in the UI. Comments on removed lines get the little red triangle, comments on non-contextual lines get no love at all.

There's an example here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3388 in gadgetShared.css

Add a comment here:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100429-mmpqnxh8wyciacyhkgaqyq9j84.jpg!

There's no sign of it here:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100429-kwj91my7148rdm7qgdr2ns4yda.jpg!
fields.summary: Comments on lines out of context aren't indicated in the UI

fields.description:
At the moment if you want a user to not count towards the licensing you have to delete that user. The problem with that is you lose the ability to search by that user for comments etc. 

We should allow you to deactivate users so they cannot use the application and do not count towards the user total. 

UPDATE: when having both FishEye and Crucible licences, there is an option presented to enable Crucible access for individual users, see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Deleting+or+deactivating+a+user.  But when having only Crucible licence, there is no way to deactivate the user, the only option is to delete the user.
fields.summary: Allow users to be deactivated

fields.description: I'd love to have Crucible integration for the up-and-coming Qt Creator IDE.
fields.summary: IDE connector for Qt Creator

fields.description:
We are using crucible at http://fisheye5.atlassian.com/cru and recently it seems to have been upgraded to a newer version.

However some of our reviews have stopped working since the upgrade. They all fail with the following exception. 

javax.servlet.jsp.JspException: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "leading directories"
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "leading directories"
For input string: "leading directories"
You are running release CR2.2.1 FE2.2.1 (build-467 2010-03-08), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

Here are the reviews you can use to reproduce the problem.
http://fisheye5.atlassian.com/cru/SFIN-179/review
http://fisheye5.atlassian.com/cru/SFIN-180/review
fields.summary: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "leading directories"

fields.description:
Currently open reviews have state {{Review}} whereas open snippets have state {{OpenSnippet}}.
The same goes for closed reviews and snippets: {{Closed}} vs {{ClosedSnippet}.
Similar inconsistencies regard transitions ({{reopenReview}} vs. {{reopenSnippet}})

It does not make sense and complicates the client code. We already have {{type}} attribute which differentiates regular reviews from snippets.

What is the rationale about introducing different statuses, transitions and actions for snippet and regular reviews?
fields.summary: [REST API] make snippet and review data consistent

fields.description:
Originally, I tried to upgrade directly from our currently installed version of Crucible, 1.6.2.1, to the latest and greatest, 2.2.1. Because that failed, while executing sql upgrade scripts, I tried to upgrade in smaller steps.

So I then upgraded (the original, backed up) version 1.6.2.1 to 1.6.3, which was fine (and did not involve any db upgrade script, according to fisheye.out). I continued and upgraded from 1.6.3 directly to 1.6.6, which was fine, too. Again, no sql upgrade scripts run in that step, either.

In the next step, from 1.6.6 to 2.0.0, crucible exited during the sql upgrade process. The fisheye.out starts like this:

{noformat}
INFO  - FishEye/Crucible 2.0.0 (build-410), Built on 2009-06-29
INFO  - FishEye: Commercial License registered to TradingScreen Inc. Japan. ()
INFO  - Periodic polling for software updates is disabled.
INFO  - Starting plugin system...
INFO  - Starting database...
INFO  - Upgrading DB from version 29 using /data/tsbuild/crucible/fecru-2.0.0/sql/HSQL/upgrade/upgrade_29.sql
INFO  - Upgrading DB from version 30 using /data/tsbuild/crucible/fecru-2.0.0/sql/HSQL/upgrade/upgrade_30.sql
INFO  - Upgrading DB from version 31 using /data/tsbuild/crucible/fecru-2.0.0/sql/HSQL/upgrade/upgrade_31.sql
INFO  - Upgrading DB from version 32 using /data/tsbuild/crucible/fecru-2.0.0/sql/HSQL/upgrade/upgrade_32.sql
INFO  - Upgrading DB from version 33 using /data/tsbuild/crucible/fecru-2.0.0/sql/HSQL/upgrade/upgrade_33.sql
ERROR - Context initialization failed
org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'dbControlFactory' defined in ServletContext resource [/WEB-INF/applicationContext.xml]: Instantiation of bean failed; nested exception is
 org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Could not instantiate bean class [com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.DBControlFactoryImpl]: Constructor threw exception; nested exception is com.cenqua.crucible.hibernate.CruD
BException: Problem upgrading with script /data/tsbuild/crucible/fecru-2.0.0/sql/HSQL/upgrade/upgrade_33.sql: SQL script error on line 47: "insert into cru_frx_comment (select cru_comment, cru_frx_id from cru_revision_comment
 where cru_line_range is null);"
(Violation of unique constraint SYS_PK_643: duplicate value(s) for column(s) CRU_COMMENT_ID), please contact http://www.atlassian.com/support/
        at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.ConstructorResolver.autowireConstructor(ConstructorResolver.java:254)
{noformat}

The full output is attached to this JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Upgrade from 1.6.6 to 2.0.0 failed

fields.description:
To re-produce: Start Review > Explore Repositories > Select Repository > Select Author
The search window resets to the screen "This review has no repository." Nothing is thrown in Error
fields.summary: Upgraded to FE 2.2.2, Can no longer add files via browse or search
GWTify Admin >> Reusable Screen Widgets, Validation Framework, General Page UI

fields.description:
When adding in-line comments to a non-anchored Patch file, we have observed that the comment will not save properly in some instances.

Steps to reproduce:
1.  Create a patch file which deletes one or more lines from a file.
2.  Create a review with the patch file.  Do not anchor it to FishEye.
3.  Add an in-line comment to the deleted portion of the code.  Do not select added or unchanged code.

Expected behavior:
* The comment will save correctly

Observed behavior:
* The comment will not save, and display an error message.  When expanding the details, the message is very long and incomprehensible.
fields.summary: In-line comments sometimes do not save for non-anchored Patch files

fields.description:
To provide better flexibility for notifications, it would be great to set the Reply-To header.

In one particular situation, if Crucible is configured to send emails from a user email address, all automated replies (such as Out of office) are spammed back to the user's email address when comment/reply/review notifications are sent.
fields.summary: Support setting the Reply-To header for emails

fields.description:
By default, the "Line wrapping" option via user profile is set to "None" in which the long lines will never word wrap, setting it to "Soft" will word wrap the long lines. However, this doesn't work as expected.

See the attached screen shot
fields.summary: Line wrapping in comment doesn't work as expected

fields.description:
Some links are broken, if Crucible is bounded via AJPv13 to Apache. The defect links contain an additional port number. 

My configuration is:
<web-server context="crucible" site-url="https://hostname/">
        <ajp13 bind="localhost:8060" />
</web-server>

With this config can I access the Crucible user interface and make administrative settings. But if it comes to the point to create code reviews than point some buttons and links to http://hostname:8003/crucible/... 

Whereas I never configured port 8003. 

The "Create Review" button leads to an timeout. But a non-configured review is created.
These reviews could not be accessed from the review list, because these links are broken too (http://hostname:8003/crucible/cru/CR-3).

Also to mention is, that the Crucible reference from the Apache is set via https and the broken links using http.
fields.summary: Wrong HTTP Links with AJP

fields.description:
This has come up in a few support cases --- somehow favourites in the db are getting corrupted, and they take down pages rather than being handled gracefully.  Its happened on a number of types of favourite, enough that I think its worth investigating for all types.

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3661
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-1575
fields.summary: Corrupted/invalid favourites aren't handled well

fields.description:
When emailing a review, it contains links to the comments in crucible. However the revision comments do not have any context. 

{quote}Revision Comment by Directory Superuser on 19 April 2010, 14:09 
https://erdinger.sydney.atlassian.com/fisheye/cru/CR-1/#c6,832

  test test test
{quote}

We should include the filename / line number(s) / revision to which the comment applies as well.
fields.summary: Include more context in mail notifications

fields.description: It would be nice if you could do a filter search for a specific path, e.g. all open reviews for /some/file.c  Right now if we want to find all open reviews for a file we either have to fetch all open reviews, then get the files attached to each review OR get the list of all reviews ever created for that file.  In my situation we have a few hundred reviews created each day and it is untenable to continue much futher with either existing option.
fields.summary: filtered search for reviews for a specific path

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm managing a huge development forge with more than 780 projects and we use JIRA as the central point to manage user access.

We are using Crowd, Jira, Confluence, Subversion, Bamboo, FishEye and Crucible

In JIRA, we are using roles, a database trigger copies those roles within Crowd groups and we use these groups to protect confluence, subversion, bamboo, fisheye and crucible.

Example, for the project 'MYPROJECT' we have the following crowd groups:
- p.myproject.developers
- p.myproject.team.leaders
- p.myproject.users
- ...

I want to use the groups p.myproject.developers and p.myproject.team.leaders to protect the crucible project CR-MYPROJECT.

I indicate within the default reviewers, p.myproject.developers and p.myproject.team.leaders.


I want to use ONLY review roles and I do not succeed to use the customized agile permission scheme to protect the project which is :

|Abandon|Review Roles: Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Approve|Review Roles: Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Close|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Comment|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Complete|Review Roles: Reviewer|
|Create|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Delete|Review Roles: Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Edit Review Details|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Re-Open|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Recover|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Reject|Review Roles: Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Submit|Review Roles: Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Summarize|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|
|Uncomplete|Review Roles: Reviewer|
|View|Review Roles: Reviewer, Creator, Author, Moderator|

I'm member of p.myproject.team.leaders and when I try to access the projects, Crucible says to me: "You aren't part of any projects"


How can I proceed to protect crucible project depending on user groups ?

Thanks,

Bruno
fields.summary: Permissions based on groups

fields.description:
If you search for a term that returns no results there's no feedback to tell the user that the search was successful, yet fruitless.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100419-p5hhj9uit4t67k1tidb2t9d2cg.jpg!

We need to feed back a message that suggests broadening or rethinking the search term/s.
fields.summary: Poor user feedback from Quicknav search when no results found

fields.description:
The latest version of perforce adds two new commands {{p4 shelve}} and {{p4 unshelve}}.

{quote}	#208746 (Bug #15043) **
Two new commands, 'p4 shelve' and 'p4 unshelve', enable 
developers to store and retrieve files on the Perforce server 
without submitting them.  These commands make multi-tasking, 
code sharing, testing and review much easier and more practical.  
Users gain access to shelved files and their content through 
'describe', 'changes' 'fstat', 'diff', 'diff2', 'files' and 
'print'.  See 'p4 help shelve/unshelve' for more information.
{quote}

So it allows you to store a potential changeset on the server without doing a {{p4 submit}}. Might be a nice way to handle pre-commit reviews.
fields.summary: Consider use of p4 shelve / p4 unshelve for pre commit reviews

fields.description: Diagnosing problems would be easier if client side errors also appeared in server-side logs
fields.summary: Log GWT errors to a server-side log
Encrypt FishEye passwords with a salt

fields.description: if you have no favourites and go to https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/ you would expect to see nothing if you have 'Show my activity' off (which works as expected), and only your activity if you have it on. when it's on, you see everyone's activity.
fields.summary: FishEye Activity Stream shows too much when 'Show my activity' is checked

fields.description:

Refer to [FSH-3613|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3613]

Steps to reproduce:
# Assume that you have added the p4 repository in Fisheye

p4 diff -du > test.txt
{noformat}
# Create a review and upload the patch (e.g see [this guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+a+Patch+Review#CreatingaPatchReview-UsingCruciblePatchAnchoringtoAutomaticallyAddFullContext])
